data.title: Compounds
data.statement:
Give the chemical formula when the given elements combine

Elements combine in the following criteria:
The product of the atoms of <<element>>-{{1}} and its <<valency>> + The product of the atoms of <<element>>-{{2}} and its <<valency>> = {{0}}

<<Example:>> Let first element be H with valency {{+1}}, and second element be O with valency {{-2}}. Now, {{2}}x{{1}} + {{1}}x{{-2}} = {{0}}. So, the resultant compound will be [[H{{2}}O{{1}}]]. However, {{1}} is not written as default number of atoms is {{1}}. So output will be [[H2O]]

<<Note:>> If both valencies are positive or both are negative or any one is {{0}}, no compound can be formed
data.stubGenerator:
read ELEMENT1:word(100) VALENCY1:int
read ELEMENT2:word(100) VALENCY2:int
write IMPOSSIBLE
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string [[ELEMENT1]] and an integer [[VALENCY1]], denoting the name of the element and its valency
<<Line 2:>> A string [[ELEMENT2]] and an integer [[VALENCY2]], denoting the name of the element and its valency
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The resultant compound. If not possible, display a single word {{IMPOSSIBLE}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Give the chemical formula when the given elements combine

Elements combine in the following criteria:
The product of the atoms of element-1 and its valency + The product of the atoms of element-2 and its valency = 0

Example: Let first element be H with valency +1, and second element be O with valency -2. Now, 2x1 + 1x-2 = 0. So, the resultant compound will be H2O1. However, 1 is not written as default number of atoms is 1. So output will be H2O

Note: If both valencies are positive or both are negative or any one is 0, no compound can be formed
Input
Line 1: A string ELEMENT1 and an integer VALENCY1, denoting the name of the element and its valency
Line 2: A string ELEMENT2 and an integer VALENCY2, denoting the name of the element and its valency
Output
Line 1: The resultant compound. If not possible, display a single word IMPOSSIBLE
Constraints
-4 ≤ VALENCY ≤ 4
Example
Input
H 1
O -2
Output
H2O
